properties.description: Sets the main axis for item flow. Options: row (default, L→R), row-reverse (R→L), column (T→B), column-reverse (B→T). Controls direction items are laid out.
Aligns items along the main axis. Values: flex-start, flex-end, center, space-between, space-around, space-evenly. Distributes free space horizontally (row) or vertically (column).
Aligns items along the cross axis (perpendicular to main axis). Options: stretch (default), flex-start, flex-end, center, baseline. Applies to all items unless overridden.
Defines if items stay in one line (nowrap) or wrap onto multiple (wrap, wrap-reverse). Useful for responsive layouts when items can’t shrink enough to fit in one row/column.
Controls item visual order (default 0). Lower numbers first. Doesn’t affect source code order but changes layout rendering. Multiple items with same order keep DOM order.
Defines how much free space an item takes relative to siblings. Default 0 (no grow). Example: grow 1 vs 2 → item with 2 gets twice as much extra space as item with 1.
Defines how items shrink when space is tight. Default 1 (shrink). Example: shrink 0 prevents shrinking, forcing other items to shrink more. Ratios work like flex-grow but in reverse.
Sets initial size of item before grow/shrink, overriding width/height.
